meanings.sent1: The puppy would champ on his favorite toy all day.
meanings.sent2: The horse would champ on the fresh hay in the barn.
meanings.sent3: The toddler pretended to champ on the plastic food in her toy kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The gears in the old clock seemed to champ as they turned slowly.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel could be heard to champ on the nuts it found in the garden.

meanings.sent1: The soccer team's captain was the champ of the tournament.
meanings.sent2: The spelling bee champ received a shiny trophy.
meanings.sent3: The little girl proudly wore a homemade crown, declaring herself the champ of the playground.
meanings.sent4: The champ of the race crossed the finish line with a big smile.
meanings.sent5: The champ of the contest was awarded a gold medal for his outstanding performance.

meanings.sent1: The family would champ together after a successful harvest.
meanings.sent2: The fans started to champ when their team scored the winning goal.
meanings.sent3: The children began to champ as soon as they heard the ice cream truck's music.
meanings.sent4: The town would champ every year during the annual festival.
meanings.sent5: The students would champ loudly when they found out about the surprise field trip.
